Question: To what extent do relevant laws, regulations, policies, and guidance provide a basis for collecting and publishing data on land tenure?
Existence
Are there laws, policies or regulations requiring collection or publication of this information in any form?
Option1: They are being drafted, or are not yet implemented.

Question: Do relevant laws, policies, regulations or guidance discuss collection and publication of structured and open data?
Option0: Relevant laws, policies and guidance explicitly create barriers to collecting and publishing structured data
Option1: There is no mention of data in relevant laws, policies or guidance
Option2: Requirements to collect data are set out in non-binding policy or guidance
Option3: Requirements to collect data are set out in binding policy, regulations or law
Option4: Requirements to publish data are set out in non-binding policy or guidance
Option5: Requirements to publish data are set out in binding policy or law
Supporting0: 0;Please briefly detail the barriers created (e.g. requirements for paper-based filing only)
Supporting1: 2,3,4,5;Please provide a URL to the most relevant legislation, policy or guidance

Question: Elements
Part 1: What do the rules or guidance related to structured data cover?
The rules/guidance support the collection of structured data.
The rules/guidance require that data is regularly updated.
The rules/guidance empower an agency or official to ensure the accurate and timely collection and publication of required data.
The rules/guidance support publication of open data.
Part 2: What types of land tenure do the rules or guidance address?
The rules/guidance acknowledge indigenous land issues.
The rules/guidance acknowledge and envisions strategies to deal with informal land tenure data.
The rules/guidance apply to all land tenure involving natural persons
Supporting0: 1; To which kind of land tenures involving natural persons do the rules/guidance apply?

Question: The rules/guidance apply to all land tenure involving legal persons
Supporting0: 1; To which kind of land tenures involving legal persons do the rules/guidance apply?

Question: The rules/guidance apply to all land tenure involving state land
Supporting0: 1; To which kind of land tenures involving state lands do the rules/guidance apply?

Question: The rules/guidance apply to all land tenure involving communal lands
Supporting0: 1; To which kind of communal land tenures do the rules/guidance apply?

Question: The rules/guidance require the publication of land concessions data.
Supporting0: 1; To what kind of land concessions do the rules/guidance apply?

Question: The rules/guidance apply to urban and rural tenure, and to other relevant forms of tenure.
Supporting0: 1; To what kind of land tenures do the rules/guidance apply?

Question: Part 3: What other requirements do the rules or guidance set out?
The rules/guidance require publication of detailed land tenure data
Each record has a geospatial reference that allows to assign features to a spatial extent.
OptionGuidance: The geospatial reference might be latitude-longitute coordinates, an ID to associate it to a geospatial dataset, an address, etc. "Partially" is intended for cases where a geographical reference exists, but it could have been more precise, for example, when the neighbourhood is informed, but there are no clear reasons for not to inform latitude-longitude coordinates. Will be assessed with "Yes" datasets that have the most granular geographic references that can be expected for its kind.

Question: The rules/guidance support the collection and publication of structured historical land tenure data
The rules/guidance support collection of data about the gender of those holding land tenure
The rules/guidance establish funding to sustain the collection and release of this data over multiple years.
Extent
Does the framework cover the collection and/or publication of tenure data of the majority of land?
Option0: The framework(s) for data collection and/or publication covers a small proportion of land tenure in the country?
Option1: The framework(s) for data collection and/or publication covers a large proportion of land tenure in the country, but not all?
Option2: The framework(s) for data collection and/or publication cover all forms of land tenure in the country?
Supporting0: What kind of land tenure does it cover? If there are different frameworks, please provide url source for each.
Supporting1: What kind of land tenure does it cover? If there are different frameworks, please provide url source for each.
Supporting2: What kind of land tenure does it cover? If there are different frameworks, please provide url source for each.

Question: To what extent is detailed and structured land tenure data available for re-use?
Existence
Is this data available online in any form?
Option1: Data is available, but not as a result of government action
Option2: Data is available from government, or because of government actions
Supporting0: 0;Are there other offline ways to access this data in the country? (e.g. attending an office to inspect it)
Supporting1: 1;If government is not providing access to data, how is this data available?
Supporting2: 1,2;Please provide a URL for where this data can be found

Question: Elements
Part 1: General checklist
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
Supporting0: 1,2;Please provide a URL where this machine-readable data can be found. (Additional URLs can be included in the justification and supporting evidence)
Supporting1: 1,2;Please provide a comma separated list of the formats available? (E.g. csv, json)
Supporting2: 1;What prevents you from assessing this data as fully machine-readable?

Question: The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole
OptionGuidance: Answer no if it's only possible to access individual records; Answer partially if it's possible to export extracts of the data; Answer yes if there are bulk downloads or APIs providing access to the whole dataset without financial, technical or legal barriers.
Supporting0: 1,2;Please provide a URL where bulk download access is available or described.
Supporting1: 1,2;If bulk access is provided through an API, please provide a link to where the API is described.

Question: Data is openly licensed.
Supporting0: 0;If there are explicit restrictions placed on re-use of the dataset, briefly describe those here.
Supporting1: 1,2;If the data is provided with an explicit open license, please provide the name of the license, or a link to it here.

Question: Dataset is available free of charge.
Data is timely and updated.
Supporting0: When was the most recent update to this dataset?

Question: There are accessible and open official tools available to help users locate and explore individual records.
OptionGuidance: Answer 'partially' if tools make it possible to get at extracts of data without having to download a full dataset. Answer 'yes' if there is an interactive tool that displays user-filtered extracts of the data to answer simple questions without downloading data at all.
Supporting1: 1;What are the main barriers to accessibility and usability?

Question: Part 2: Types of land tenure
Datasets have information regarding indigenous people.
The data covers land tenure involving natural persons.
OptionGuidance: In some cases, information on individual rights holders may be available under more restrictive licenses than general rights information. In these cases, you can indicate that data on natural persons is ‘partially’ available.
Supporting0: 1,2; Are individual owners identified in the dataset?

Question: The data covers land tenure involving legal persons.
Supporting0: 1,2; What information is provided to identify legal owners (e.g. company registration number, company name, address etc.)?
Supporting1: 1,2; Is information provided on the beneficial ownership of land held by legal persons?

Question: The data covers land tenure involving state land.
The data covers land tenure involving communal lands.
The data covers land tenure involving open access lands.
The data covers urban and rural tenure, and other relevant forms of tenure.
The data covers and has information on land concessions.
Part 3: Other dataset elements
Each record has a geospatial reference that allows to assign features to a spatial extent.
OptionGuidance: The geospatial reference might be latitude-longitute coordinates, an ID to associate it to a geospatial dataset, an address, etc. "Partially" is intended for cases where a geographical reference exists, but it could have been more precise, for example, when the neighbourhood is informed, but there are no clear reasons for not to inform latitude-longitude coordinates. Will be assessed with "Yes" datasets that have the most granular geographic references that can be expected for its kind.

Question: The data contains information on historical tenure (i.e. not only current records for each land parcel).
The data contains information on land transactions and sale-values.
The data contains gender disaggregation.
Each tenure record contains information about the rights held over the land.
Extent
Do the datasets available cover the tenure data of the majority of land?
Option0: __The datasets available cover a small proportion of land tenure in the country__
Option1: __The datasets available cover a big proportion of land tenure in the country, but not all.__
Option2: __The datasets available cover all forms of land tenure in the country__
Supporting0: 0,1,2; What kind of land tenure does it cover?
